description: European Newsletter Axiom Checker - 10 non-negotiable axioms for evaluating newsletter items

axioms.title: Legitimacy is fragile
axioms.description: Political and social legitimacy cannot be assumed; it must be continuously earned through transparent, accountable processes

axioms.title: Adjustment must be credible
axioms.description: Regulatory and policy changes must be implementable and enforceable, not just aspirational

axioms.title: Errors must carry cost
axioms.description: Systems must have meaningful consequences for failures to ensure accountability

axioms.title: Knowledge is dispersed and tacit
axioms.description: Critical knowledge exists across organizations and individuals, not centralized; local context matters

axioms.title: Incentives dominate intentions
axioms.description: Actual behavior follows incentive structures, not stated goals or good intentions

axioms.title: Competition law is Europe's operating system
axioms.description: EU competition and state-aid rules fundamentally constrain what is politically and economically possible

axioms.title: AI must augment judgment, not replace it
axioms.description: AI systems should enhance human decision-making, not eliminate human accountability

axioms.title: Architecture determines sustainability
axioms.description: System design choices (including energy, compute, data flows) determine long-term viability and environmental impact

axioms.title: Leverage beats ownership
axioms.description: Strategic positioning and influence matter more than direct control or ownership

axioms.title: Symbolism is not execution
axioms.description: Announcements, commitments, and rhetoric must be distinguished from actual implementation and results
